text: Leftover brine pickles #1 Wash and dry the cucumber or zucchini.  Slice the cucumber or zucchini thinly. You can use a food processor to create a fancy edge if wished. Pack the slices into the cleaned pickle jar, on top of one another.  Pour over the original brine. If needed, top up with a little additional quality white vinegar. Seal the jar. Place in the refrigerator. Leave for a minimum of six days to allow the brine to infuse the slices. After this time, you can consume the pickles. Keep refrigerated until finished. Leftover brine pickles #2 Cut the cucumbers thickly.  Place the slices in a heatproof bowl. Cover with white vinegar. Add sugar to taste and red pepper flakes.  Bring the leftover pickle brine to a boil.  Pour the boiled leftover brine into the bowl of cucumbers. Let cool, then cover. Toss over now and then during the following few hours.  Serve. These should taste good as soon as cooled. Store in the refrigerator.
